page.title: 16Hill Farming round Whiston
page.content: Mr Williamson is a dairy farmer. He has 70 acres - forty pasture and thirty meadows. He has thirty five Holste acres -forty thirty young cattle. Underneath the ground it is mainly sandstone, which is quarried and used for boundaries to fields. The milk goes to Ashborne to make milk products. In the winter he attends to the animals and manures the fields. In the spring, he harrows and rolls and spreads fed fertilizers to grow grass. In the summer he harvests the grass for winter cattle feed. In the autumn he tries to grow more grass with fertilizers to keep the cattle in the fields longer. In severe winters the water freezes so he gets less milk, and the milk tankers have difficulty in collecting milk in heavy snows.
